channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Opp 74 Balmoral Ave, 21st January
item.description:
Third time to report overflowing bin which you keep shutting report down on. Not resolved.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mountbatten Gardens, Elmers End, Greater London

item.description:
Residents have left rubbish outside bin store, some rubbish now scattered onto pavement and road.

item.title: Estate gate unlocked(linsey street se16 3ue), 21st January
item.description:

item.title: Dropped drain, huge hole, 21st January
item.description:
Dropped drain which has left a huge hole in the road. It is on a bend in a narrow stretch which is so dangerous to try and avoid it. It has been like this and getting worse for over a week!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmstead Lane, Elmstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Encroaching road access, 21st January
item.description:
This was responded too blaming network rail, fair enough it looks like it originates in their land, but you can cut your area back to the fence. It's so overgrown you can't see the kerb or the letters on the road in full. Its a corner and has a nursery so its important for safety to be kept clear.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lower Station Road, Crayford, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped Rubbish, 21st January
item.description:
Rubbish dumped and a number of nitrous oxide canisters on the roadside at the end of Tyler Street.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Tyler Street, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping in bin area next to Barbrook House, 21st January
item.description:
There is a bed frame, a sort of mattress and a Christmas tree. Additionally, there’s some smaller rubbish around too. The bed frame has been there since Sunday, the Christmas tree since last night and I am not sure about the other one.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Paragon Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Playground doors are broken, 21st January
item.description:
Doors are broken so dogs are coming in to the playground. It makes children scared because big dogs are coming in too.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Warwick Grove, Hackney, London

item.title: Backyard is full of dog poo, 21st January
item.description:
Block 86-110's backyard is full of dog poo. Residents are not cleaning after their dog. No dogs should allowed to backyard anyway. Please clean asap for environment safety.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Warwick Grove, Hackney, London

item.title: Parked illegally on double yellow lines, 21st January
item.description:
There is a tow truck parked outside my house which is well over the double yellow lines. This parking is illegal and it’s on a corner and there is a parked car on the other side so it’s a tight squeeze. Can someone do something about this truck

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sweet Briar Grove, Edmonton, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegal parking obstruction, 21st January
item.description:
This tow truck has been parked her illegally for hours and needs to be fined. It’s on a corner and parked in two yellow lines which is a parking offence.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sweet Briar Grove, Edmonton, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Furniture shop blocking the street, 21st January
item.description:
The crossing and the street keeps being blocked by the furniture shop on the corner. It’s difficult for people to walk by and almost impossible for prams or wheelchairs without going into the road. This is a recurrent issue.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Sandy Hill Road, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic lights not working, 21st January
item.description:
The traffic lights on the junction of Southwark Street and Southwark Bridge Road are constantly breaking down. This is a very busy road and it is unacceptable that these lights do not work as if makes it very dangerous for anybody trying to cross, especially children and disabled people who may need extra time.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 59 1/2, Southwark Street, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
